Title: Topographic organization of cortical visual afferents to extrastriate visual area PO in the Macaque: A dual tracer study.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Region_Parcellation: Visual areas in occipital, parietal and temporal cortex

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "...the dorsal prelunate area (DPL), a small area representing the upper visual field exclusively (Van Essen, 1985)." (p. 407)

"The lateral bank of the intraparietal sulcus is a myeloarchitectonically heterogeneous zone...These divisons were first noted by Seltzer and Pandya (1980) usingn the Heidenhain technique, and were called POae and POai...Two similar divisions are visible in material stained by the Gallyas method. The first...contains a portion of the ventral intraparietal area (VIP), defined by Maunsell and Van Essen (1983) as the MT projection zone near the fundus of the sulcus...The second...region...corresponds, in part, to the lateral intraparietal area (LIP) by Andersen et al. (1985)...we have not attempted to distinguish between them and have assigned all labeld cells...to a conjoint area LIP/VIP." (pp. 396-397)

"The lateral bank of the intraparietal sulcus is a myeloarchitectonically heterogeneous zone...These divisons were first noted by Seltzer and Pandya (1980) usingn the Heidenhain technique, and were called POae and POai...Two similar divisions are visible in material stained by the Gallyas method. The first...contains a portion of the ventral intraparietal area (VIP), defined by Maunsell and Van Essen (1983) as the MT projection zone near the fundus of the sulcus...The second...region...corresponds, in part, to the lateral intraparietal area (LIP) by Andersen et al. (1985)...we have not attempted to distinguish between them and have assigned all labeld cells...to a conjoint area LIP/VIP." (pp. 396-397)

"Adjacent to V2 is a thin stripe of cortex which contains the dorsal (V3d) and ventral (V3v) portions of area V3 (Gattas et al. 1985, 1988; Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986). Area V3d frequently stands out as being more densely myelinated than adjacent areas (see Burkhalter et al., 1986, Fig. 3)." (CGOG88, p. 396) "We have maintained the name V3 for the dorsal region and have adopted the name VP...for the ventral region...In the Discussion, we will return to the issue of terminology and will suggest alternative names (V3d/V3v..." (BFNV86, p. 67)

"Adjacent to V2 is a thin stripe of cortex which contains the dorsal (V3d) and ventral (V3v) portions of area V3 (Gattas et al. 1985, 1988; Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986)." (p. 396) "Area V3 is a narrow strip of cortex adjacent to V2. The dorsal portion, V3d, represents the lower visual field (Gattas et al., 1985, 1988)." (p. 406)

"Adjacent to V2 is a thin stripe of cortex which contains the dorsal (V3d) and ventral (V3v) portions of area V3 (Gattas et al. 1985, 1988; Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986)." (CGOG88, p. 396) "An alternative pair of names, V3d and V3v, has recently been suggested in addition to the V3/VP nomenclature (Burkhalter et al., 1986; Ungerleider and Desimone, 1986) and we consider either to be acceptable." (NMV86, p. 150)

"Adjacent to V2 is a thin stripe of cortex which contains the dorsal (V3d) and ventral (V3v) portions of area V3 (Gattas et al. 1985, 1988; Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986)." (CGOG88, p. 396) "An alternative pair of names, V3d and V3v, has recently been suggested in addition to the V3/VP nomenclature (Burkhalter et al., 1986; Ungerleider and Desimone, 1986) and we consider either to be acceptable." (NMV86, p. 150)

"Adjacent to V2 is a thin stripe of cortex which contains the dorsal (V3d) and ventral (V3v) portions of area V3 (Gattas et al. 1985, 1988; Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986)." (CGOG88, p. 396) "We have maintained the name V3 for the dorsal region and have adopted the name VP...for the ventral region...In the Discussion, we will return to the issue of terminology and will suggest alternative names (V3d/V3v..." (BFNV86, p. 67)
"The ventral portion, V3v, represents the upper visual field and is referred to as area VP by Van Essen and colleagues (Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986)." (p. 406)
"The ventral portion, V3v, represents the upper visual field and is referred to as area VP by Van Essen and colleagues (Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986)." (p. 406)
"Adjacent to V2 is a thin stripe of cortex which contains the dorsal (V3d) and ventral (V3v) portions of area V3 (Gattas et al. 1985, 1988; Burkhalter et al., 1986; Newsome et al., 1986)." (p. 396)
"Area V4 adjoins area V3v ventrally and areas V3d and V3A dorsally and was identified by myeloarchitecture and gyral morphology (Van Essen and Zeki, 1978; Gattas et al., 1985, 1988)." (p. 407)
"Area V4 adjoins area V3v ventrally and areas V3d and V3A dorsally and was identified by myeloarchitecture and gyral morphology (Van Essen and Zeki, 1978; Gattas et al., 1985, 1988)." (p. 407)

"Area V4T is a small myeloarchitectonically distinct zone in the ventral bank of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) between areas V4 and MT (...Ungerleider and Desimone, 1986b...). In V4T, the background is pale in myelin-stained sections and the bands of Baillarger are quite thin compared to those in V4 (see Ungerleider and Desimone, 1986b, Fig. 4C)." (p. 396)

"VIP was defined by Maunsell and Van Essen (1983) as the MT projection zone within the intraparietal sulcus...LIP was described by Andersen et al. (1985) as that part of the lateral bank of the intraparietal sulcus which projects to the frontal lobe. This zone may overlap in part with the MT-projection zone (VIP) described above." (p. 407)
"MIP is defined here as the posterior portion of the medial bank of the intraparietal sulcus. This region has classically been considered part of area 5 (Brodmann, 1905)." (p. 409)

"Area MST is a myeloarchitectonically heterogeneous area in the dorsal bank of STS...and is distinct from area FST in the fundus of STS (Desimone and Ungerleider, 1986)...The lateral border of the area MST coincides with the lateral border of the densely myelinated zone (see Ungerleider and Desimone, 1986a: Fig. 4A)." (p. 396)
"Area PO...is...located on the anterior bank of the parieto-occipital sulcus..."

"The borders of several prestriate areas can be identified in sections stained for myelin...The criteria for distinguishing the borders of V2, V3, V4, MT, and PO in sections stained by the Heidenhain-Woelke method have been described previously (Gattas and Gross, 1981; Gattas et al., 1981, 1985, 1988)." (p. 395)
@InterMapRelations.Comments: Gattas and Gross (1981) describe the myeloarchitecture of MT.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The borders of several prestriate areas can be identified in sections stained for myelin...The criteria for distinguishing the borders of V2, V3, V4, MT, and PO in sections stained by the Heidenhain-Woelke method have been described previously (Gattas and Gross, 1981; Gattas et al., 1981, 1985, 1988)." (p. 395)
@InterMapRelations.Comments: Gattas et al. 1981 (GGS81) describe the myeloarchitecture of area V2.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The borders of several prestriate areas can be identified in sections stained for myelin...The criteria for distinguishing the borders of V2, V3, V4, MT, and PO in sections stained by the Heidenhain-Woelke method have been described previously (Gattas and Gross, 1981; Gattas et al., 1981, 1985, 1988)." (p. 395)
@InterMapRelations.Comments: GSG88 describe the myeloarchitecture of V3 and V4.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The borders of several prestriate areas can be identified in sections stained for myelin...The criteria for distinguishing the borders of V2, V3, V4, MT, and PO in sections stained by the Heidenhain-Woelke method have been described previously (Gattas and Gross, 1981; Gattas et al., 1981, 1985, 1988)." (p. 395)
@InterMapRelations.Comments: GSG88 describe the myeloarchitecture of V3 and V4.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "Area MT is a heavily myelinated zone in the ventral bank of STS which in some cases extends into the fundus (see Ungerleider and Mishkin, 1979: Fig. 6; Van Essen et al., 1981: Fig. 1; Gattas and Gross, 1981)." (p. 396)
@InterMapRelations.Corrected_Why:
Quote from CGOG88:
"Area MT is a heavily myelinated zone in the ventral
bank of STS which in some cases extends into the fundus
(see Ungerleider and Mishkin, '79: Fig. 6; Van Essen et al.,
'81: Fig. 1; Gattass and Gross, '81). Area MT contains a
homogeneous dark band of fibers, extending from layer 6
to the bottom of layer 3, which largely obscures the bands " I of Baillarger."

Given the focus on heavy myelination, CGOG88-MT is equal to VMB81-MT rather than GG81-MT or UM79-MT.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "Area MT is a heavily myelinated zone in the ventral bank of STS which in some cases extends into the fundus (see Ungerleider and Mishkin, 1979: Fig. 6; Van Essen et al., 1981: Fig. 1; Gattas and Gross, 1981)." (p. 396)
@InterMapRelations.Corrected_Why:
Quote from CGOG88:
"Area MT is a heavily myelinated zone in the ventral
bank of STS which in some cases extends into the fundus
(see Ungerleider and Mishkin, '79: Fig. 6; Van Essen et al.,
'81: Fig. 1; Gattass and Gross, '81). Area MT contains a
homogeneous dark band of fibers, extending from layer 6
to the bottom of layer 3, which largely obscures the bands " I of Baillarger."

Given the focus on heavy myelination, CGOG88-MT is equal to VMB81-MT rather than GG81-MT or UM79-MT.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "Area MT is a heavily myelinated zone in the ventral bank of STS which in some cases extends into the fundus (see Ungerleider and Mishkin, 1979: Fig. 6; Van Essen et al., 1981: Fig. 1; Gattas and Gross, 1981)." (p. 396)

"Area PO, first described by Covey et al. (1982), is a visual area located on the anterior bank of the parieto-occipital sulcus...Covey et al. (1982) observed that area PO, as defined by electrophysiological mapping, can be distingusihed from adjacent areas in sections stained for myelin by using the Heidenhain-Woelke method. Area PO can also be identified in sections stained for myelin by the Gallyas (1969) method, as shown in Figure 2." (p. 393) "The location of the upper and lower visual field representations in area PO was in accord with previous mapping studies of the area (Covey et al., 1982)." (p. 397)
"Some of the results have been published in abstract form (Colby et al., 1983)."
@InterMapRelations.Comments: CGOG83 is the SocNeurosci abstract of CGOG88.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The region referred to as PP includes cortex within the lightly myelinated lateral portion of the dorsal bank of STS and the cortex of the posterior inferior parietal lobule (Desimone and Ungerleider, 1986). It is approximately euqivalent to area 7a." (p. 396)
@InterMapRelations.Comments: AAC85 define an area 7a of similar location.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The region referred to as PP includes cortex within the lightly myelinated lateral portion of the dorsal bank of STS and the cortex of the posterior inferior parietal lobule (Desimone and Ungerleider, 1986). It is approximately euqivalent to area 7a." (p. 396)
"Area V2 adjoins V1 at its posterior border. The anterior border was estimated on the basis of of previous recording studies (Gattas et al., 1981) and myeloarchitecture." (p. 396)
"The location of area V3A was estimated from previous recording studies (Van Essen and Zeki, 1978; Gattas et al., 1985, 1988)." (p. 396)
"The location of area V3A was estimated from previous recording studies (Van Essen and Zeki, 1978; Gattas et al., 1985, 1988)." (p. 396)

Quote from CGOG88:

bank of STS which in some cases extends into the fundus

homogeneous dark band of fibers, extending from layer 6

publication.title: Topographic organization of cortical visual afferents to extrastriate visual area PO in the Macaque: A dual tracer study.
